availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip B. Hord (Carter County, Kentucky, school teacher, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, school teacher, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine Hord. Father of Hebe Hord, Mary Hord, and John Hord. School teacher in Carter County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Carter County in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Carter County.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 217B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 914.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 267.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct 1, p. 90B.
KYR-0001-029-0179.
